problem.markdown:
>>1. A synchronous motor is a useful industrial machine on account of which of the following reasons ? I. It improves the power factor of the complete installation II. Its speed is constant at all loads, provided mains frequency remains constant III. It can always be adjusted to operate at unity power factor for optimum efficiency and economy.<< ( ) I only ( ) II only ( ) III only (x) I, II and III.
>>2) In a synchronous motor if the back emf generated in the armature at no load is approximately equal to the applied voltage, then<< ( ) the torque generated is maximum ( ) the excitation is said to be zero percent (x) the excitation is said to be 100% ( ) the motor is said to be fully loaded
>>3) A synchronous motor working on leading power factor and not driving any mechanical, is known<< (x) synchronous condenser ( ) spinning motor ( ) synchronous induction motor ( ) none of the above
>>4) The constant speed of a synchronous motor can be changed to new fixed value by<< ( ) changing the applied voltage ( ) interchanging any two phases ( ) changing the load (x) changing the frequency of supply.
>>5) A synchronous machine has its field winding on the stator and armature winding on the rotor. Under steady running conditions, the air-gap field<< ( ) rotates at synchronous speed with direction of rotation of the rotor (x) remains stationary with respect to stator ( ) remains stationary with respect to rotor. ( ) rotates at synchronous speed with respect to stator
